body:
When you go to the C:/ProgramFiles/DesktopRadiance/ProjectName  folder, is there a .oct file there?

Andrew

thank you andrew, the first thing i checked was this. but, no the file name is radiance, and the path folder name is radiance too. the layers name are correct, too

On Tue, Mar 12, 2013 at 8:57 PM, Bissell, Andrew <a.bissell at cundall.com<mailto:a.bissell at cundall.com>> wrote:
Apologies for stating the obvious.  But just check that you don't have any blank spaces in any of your CAD layer names or drawing filename.

Regards

Andrew

Andrew Bissell

after i finish everything and click the render button, in order to analyse and give me the result in the black page that shows the analyse processing it writes the error and stops analysing
On Tue, Mar 12, 2013 at 8:37 PM, Guglielmetti, Robert <Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov<mailto:Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov>> wrote:
We're gonna need a little more info than that, again with the caveat that Desktop Radiance hasn't been officially supported in ages.

With that said, what exactly are you doing that produces the error message?

Rob Guglielmetti
National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
Commercial Buildings Research Group
15013 Denver West Parkway MS:RSF202
Golden, CO 80401
303.275.4319
robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov<mailto:robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov>



On 3/12/13 11:02 AM, "shailan zareiy" <sh.zareiy at gmail.com<mailto:sh.zareiy at gmail.com><mailto:sh.zareiy at gmail.com<mailto:sh.zareiy at gmail.com>>> wrote:




hi every body
I've recently installed my desktop radiance again, but unfortunatly when i want to analyse, this error occurs : system- cannot open octree file " filename.oct" : no such file or directory
Does anyone knows what is the problem?
thanks
Shailan
